definition: bitterness finishes, sweetness begins (idiom); the hard times are over, the good times just beginning
bitter/hardship/pain/to suffer/to bring suffering to/painstakingly
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
surname Gan/abbr. for Gansu Province 甘肅省|甘肃省[Gan1 su4 Sheng3]
sweet/willing
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: He prayed for his friends and turned things around, enjoyed happiness after long suffering.
sentences.chinese: 爲朋友祈禱，成爲轉捩點，苦盡甘來。

sentences.english: Sweet are the uses of adversity.
; You have had the bitter, now comes the sweet.
Please believe a son, believe we will be luck turns after hardship.
sentences.chinese: 請您相信兒子，相信我們會苦盡甘來。

sentences.english: After years of hard work, Mr. Jones is finally living on easy street.
sentences.chinese: 辛勤工作好幾年後，瓊斯先生終於可以苦盡甘來了。

sentences.english: It was also said that today's pain is for tomorrow's harvest, Gujinganlai just.
sentences.chinese: 也有人說今天的痛苦是爲了明天的豐收，苦盡甘來嘛。

sentences.english: Love a person, is the sunshine.
sentences.chinese: 愛一個人，是苦盡甘來的。

sentences.english: Tough times never last but tough people do.
sentences.chinese: 艱苦的時光終將過去，堅強的人必將苦盡甘來。

definition: to be popular/to be getting on well/much in demand
young and vigorous (idiom)
to have boundless prospects
honorable even in defeat (idiom)
using a wicker basket to draw water (idiom); wasted effort
industrious and conscientious/assiduous
cheerful/happy
to make an effort to become strong (idiom); determined to do better/to pull one's socks up
precious darling (often refers to one's child)/sweetheart
diligent and thrifty (idiom)
When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
after one's heart (idiom); gratifying and satisfactory/everything one could wish
proficiency in a particular field (idiom)/skill in a specialized area (idiom)
to work energetically for prosperity (of the country)
depressed/cheerless
lit. ten thousand strings of cash in money belt (idiom); carrying lots of money/extremely wealthy/loaded
